result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Garrett M. Delagrave

records.addlTxt: Atty Hayes acknowledges rec. information, waives reading.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  Atty Hayes stands mute.  Court enters NG pleas and goes off the record to address scheduling.  All three cases, 22CF505, 21CF709 and 21CF809, set for a global plea/sent date.  Bonds continued.

10:07 AM Defendant Garrett M. Delagrave in court, in custody.  Attorney Kathryn E Hayes in court for Garrett M. Delagrave.  Prosecuting attorney Emily Eklund in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and appearances.  Court notes she has been provided a written waiver of prelim.  Court questions DE on waiver of prelim/accepts/finds probable cause/binds DE over.  Court notes 21CF809 and 21CF709 are also on the calendar for today.  Atty Hayes addresses scheduling.  Court clarifies.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 24, 2023 at 01:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 24, 2023 at 01:00 pm.

1:34 PM Defendant Garrett M. Delagrave in court, in custody.  Attorney Kathryn E Hayes in court for Garrett M. Delagrave.  Prosecuting attorney Emily Eklund in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Hayes advises due to the new case they are not ready to proceed today as there is a new global offer.  Atty Hayes expects DE to get an ATR between 90-120 days.  Matter reset.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
2:36 PM Defendant Garrett M. Delagrave appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Leonie Dolch appeared by video for Garrett M. Delagrave.  Prosecuting attorney Gabriel David Arevalo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  DE does qualify for PD and will have Atty Hayes appointed.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  State makes bail argument.  Atty Dolch responds.  Time limits waived for preliminary hearing.  $10,000.00 signature bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  No contact with R.S. or M.J.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 11:45 am.
Return date scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Return date on September 21, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on September 16, 2022 at 11:45 am.
